events.message: The customer filed a claim after their car was involved in a rear-end collision at a stoplight. Vehicle sustained significant rear damage.
Claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident cluster due to keywords including car and collision in the report.
An insurance agent was promptly assigned to manage the claimant’s case and provide regular updates on progress.
The insurer acknowledged receipt of the claim and confirmed that the investigation would commence shortly.
Request was made for the customer to submit a police report and photos of the vehicle’s damaged areas.
Customer submitted all requested documents including the police report, vehicle photos, and damage assessment form.
Investigation team began reviewing submitted evidence and contacting involved parties to verify claim details.
The investigation was completed confirming that the claimant was not at fault and damage matched incident report.
A settlement was proposed offering to cover the repair costs and provide a rental vehicle for three days.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the speedy handling of their claim.
The claim was officially approved, authorising the payment process to begin as per the agreed settlement terms.
Settlement payment was issued to the claimant’s account to cover vehicle repairs and associated expenses.
The claim was closed successfully after confirming the claimant received payment and all repairs were underway.
Final documentation and case files were archived following closure to maintain records for any future reference.
